text.content:
JOB#: 929784

PATIENT NAME: AVIVAPATIENT, SIX

DATE OF ADMISSION: 5/30/2012

DATE OF DISCHARGE: 6/2/2012

DIAGNOSES: Pyelonephritis

PROCEDURE/OP PERFORMED:  None.

HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS: Patient is a 55 year old female veteran, that came 
to the ER on 5/30 with the complaints Fever of 103 at home, generalize lower 
back pain, hematuria, dysuria X 48 hours.  When patient arrived at the ER, she 
reported nausea, vomiting, and unable to tolarate food or fluids that day. Prior 
to the onset of these symptoms she was feeling well. 

PAST MEDICAL HISTORY: 
Hypertension, Depression, type 2 Diabetes, Hyperlipidemia, Osteopenia.  History 
of malignant neoplasm of thyroid, and Postoperative hypothyroidism.  Previous 
admission last November for Pneumonia. 
 
PAST SURGICAL HISTORY:
Thyroidectomy (complete, bilateral) in 2002

PHYSICAL EXAMINATION:  VITAL SIGNS ON ADMISSION:  GENERAL:  on admission pt 
reports fever, chills x 48 hours, no recent weight gain or loss, dysuria, flank 
pain ENT: no vision changes NECK: no stiff neck 
CARDIAC:  denies chest pain  RESPIRATORY: no distress LUNGS: Mildy diminished 
breath sounds consistent with obesity ABDOMEN:  non-tender 
EXTREMITIES: no selling, +CSM

LABORATORY, RADIOLOGICAL AND OTHER PERTINENT TEST RESULTS PERTINENT TO 
ADMISSION: CBC with elevated WBC

HOSPITAL COURSE: uneventful

DISCHARGE MEDICATIONS:  Patient was discharged on 6/2/2012

DISPOSITION/FOLLOW-UP CARE:  Discharged to home in good condition. Patient was 
also scheduled for followup with PCP as needed.  Patient discharged with a 
prescription for a 14 day course of Antibitoics. follow up with PCP clinic if 
dysuria, flank pain return.  Go to ER for nausea/voimitng/fever.  Call 911 for 
Shortness of Breath, Chest pain.

DATE DICTATED: 6/02/12@16:13
GGS/DATE TRANSCRIBED: 18677746/06/02/2012 22:06:13
VA JobID/929784
GGSJobID/Rev: 929784/0


$END
text.author: AVIVAUSER,TWENTYNINE
